post.body:
Archmage, the board game I've been telling you about that my son invented, is done! Give it a try.

Blog: https://lisplog.org/archmage_is_done.html
Game: https://gibgoygames.com/archmage/

Archmage is all done except for the public game UI. It has chat, and the chat persists across page refresh, so it won't be lost when a portable browser gets swapped out and restarted.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage

Got the server working, as much as I could test with the simple text client. NewReq, JoinReq, PlaceReq, and ChatReq all work. Very easy. Mostly ripping out code from the Spokes server, with help from the Elm compiler.

Next: Update UI to connect to server.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage

I moved all the logic for Archmage into a file that is easily usable by the server. Same architecture as Spokes. I also auto-sized for iOS (and probably Android, but haven't tested there yet). Next: saved state.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage

I'm getting closer to a server for Archmage. I have the basic server logic all done.

Next: hook up the local game to the server logic locally.
Then: Add the actual server.

It's playable now on a single computer, and has rules and instructions. Needs JavaScript.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage

Non-networked Archmage play is now complete. Ko and all.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage/

Archmage works! And I wrote help and rules. Next: network play.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage/
I wonder how both she and I died without me even noticing.

parent.body: You come back home unexpectedly early on Saturday night and see your sister sucking on dads cock. What do you do?

conversation_parent.body: You come back home unexpectedly early on Saturday night and see your sister sucking on dads cock. What do you do?

post.body:
When I visited my son in Tennessee, he showed me two more board games that he invented. I've been making an Elm web version of one of them, Archmage. It will probably be playable, on a single computer, this weekend. Partially done now.

https://gibgoygames.com/archmage

I have finished development of the Elm version of the board game my son invented. JavaScript required.

http://lisplog.org/spokes_is_done.html
https://gibgoygames.com/spokes now does voting for an unresolvable game, not long-running code. Full home circle changes next.

https://gibgoygames.com/spokes has public games! Check "public" for "New Game". Others join from the "Public" page.

The only thing left to do is to synchronize game state after losing your connection and missing some messages about other players' moves.

https://gibgoygames.com/spokes  is now fully functional, for private games of 2 or 4 players. Next: public games.

Ask to join the Xossbow chat channel, if you want to talk with me about it.
https://gibgoygames.com/spokes  is now fully playable with two players. Just need to fix a resign bug with 4 players. Then public games and lost connection recovery.
I blogged my Spokes game. https://lisplog.org/spokes.html.
https://gibgoygames.com/spokes  now has a working server. The "Help" page says how to use it. Next: detect end of game. #myElmStatus

History and undo now work in my Elm implementation of my son's board game:  https://gibgoygames.com/spokes/

Next: networked multi-player games.

My Elm implementation of my son's Spokes board game is now playable, on a single computer.

Next: history and undo. Then: server for multi-player over the net.

https://gibgoygames.com/spokes

I have started development of a webapp for a board game that my son invented. It's called "Spokes". The board displays, and I've started on the one-user play code. Then I'll make a backend for multi-user interaction.

https://gibgoygames.com/spokes

I made this account a while back. Have used it primarily as a non-pro testing account. I will now begin using it for reports on and discussion of my Elm-based blogging package: https://Xossbow.com.

https://github.com/billstclair/xossbow
http://elm-lang.org
#xossbow #elm #software #blogging
